title: Kinzinger: Cheney 'is being run out for one thing'
description: Republican Rep. Adam Kinzinger on Monday came to the defense of soon-to-be-ousted House GOP conference chair Liz Cheney, arguing their party is poised to remove her from the influential post because she has consistently said former President Donald Trump is responsible for the US Capitol insurrection.

title: More than 1 million Honda Accords may have a steering problem. The US is investigating
description: Federal safety regulators are investigating reports that more than 1 million Honda Accords have a steering problem that can a cause a car to veer out of its lane.

title: Here's what's next after Kentucky Derby winner Medina Spirit failed a postrace drug test
description: Additional testing is planned after Kentucky Derby winner Medina Spirit failed a postrace drug test, throwing the horse's victory at Churchill Downs earlier this month into doubt.

title: Kevin McCarthy is pushing Liz Cheney out for saying almost exactly what he said after January 6
description: On January 12, Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney announced that she would vote to impeach President Donald Trump for his role in inciting the violent insurrection as the US Capitol six days earlier.

title: Stranded whale freed in London's Thames river -- and immediately goes missing again
description: Rescuers have freed a whale that swam hundreds of miles before getting stuck in London's River Thames -- but officials lost sight of the creature overnight and are now trying to find it again.

title: There were at least 9 mass shootings across the US this weekend
description: A gunman opened fire at a family birthday party in Colorado Springs, leaving six people dead and a community in mourning.

title: Dracula's castle is offering free Covid-19 vaccinations to anyone brave enough to visit
description: A Romanian castle said to be the home of Dracula is offering free Covid-19 jabs to visitors as part of a vaccination drive.

title: 'I saw it on TV!': Why Trump supporter says she believes election lie
description: A couple attending an event hosted by Rep. Matt Gaetz (R-FL) and Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) tell CNN's Donie O'Sullivan why they still believe debunked conspiracy theories cited as evidence that the 2020 presidential election was "stolen" from former President Donald Trump.

title: Former chief doctor at Russian hospital that treated Navalny found alive
description: The former chief physician of the Siberian hospital where jailed Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny was treated immediately after his poisoning last summer has been found alive, Russian state media TASS reported on Monday.

title: Rahul Vohra, Indian vlogger, dies from Covid-19 after criticizing his hospital care in final video
description: Indian actor and vlogger Rahul Vohra has died aged 35 from Covid-19, his wife said, shortly after he appeared in a final video criticizing the quality of his medical care.

title: An NYPD officer sprinted through Times Square to get a 4-year-old shooting victim to safety
description: A New York police officer sprang into action when a shooting erupted in Times Square over the weekend, wounding two women and a 4-year-old girl.

title: Death toll rises to 68 in Afghanistan girls' school bomb attack
description: The death toll from a bomb attack outside a school in the Afghan capital Kabul has risen to 68, officials said on Sunday, with doctors struggling to care for 165 injured victims and families searching desperately for missing children.

title: Unilever is tempting vaccine skeptics with free ice cream
description: Add ice cream to the growing list of free food being offered to those that get vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Apple TV+ announces Oprah Winfrey and Prince Harry series debut date
description: A highly anticipated multi-part documentary series from co-creators and executive producers Oprah Winfrey and Prince Harry, The Duke of Sussex, now has a debut date.

title: The Covid pandemic is highlighting men's mental health and how they can seek help
description: Irish musician and mental health advocate Niall Breslin was standing alone in a coffee shop in March when he was approached by an elderly man.

title: Samira Wiley and Lauren Morelli welcome a baby together
description: Samira Wiley announced on Mother's Day that she and her wife, Lauren Morelli, are new moms to a baby girl.

title: Biden administration formally launches task force to ensure scientific decisions are free from political influence
description: The Biden administration announced Monday the formal launch of its Scientific Integrity Task Force which will review the federal government's scientific policies to ensure they are free from inappropriate political influence.

title: Sorry, dogecoin. Ethereum just shot past $4,000 to a new record
description: Dogecoin may have started as (and may still be) a joke. But serious cryptocurrency investors who've bet on ethereum are laughing all the way to the bank.

title: Bird strike forces Delta Air Lines flight from Atlanta to turn around
description: A Delta flight was forced to return to Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport on Sunday night "after coming in contact with birds during takeoff," Delta Air Lines said.

title: Helmut Jahn, one of American architecture's most celebrated figures, dies age 81
description: Helmut Jahn, the architect behind some of America's best-known buildings, has died in a bicycle accident aged 81.

title: Fauci joins calls for nationwide lockdown to contain India's Covid crisis
How businesses can heed Martin Luther King, Jr.'s call to support Black banks
description: Hours before an assassin's bullet ended his life in the spring of 1968, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. — a father to one of us, a role model to the other — delivered his final public address to a Memphis crowd that had gathered to fight what he called the inseparable twins of economic and racial injustice.

title: 5 things to know about the 'conundrum' of lupus
description: Lupus is unpredictable,  triggering different symptoms in different patients. A chronic illness, it can even attack many different parts of the body.

title: John Travolta pays Mother's Day tribute to Kelly Preston
description: John Travolta marked the first Mother's Day since the loss of his wife Kelly Preston with a tribute post on social media.

title: Taylor Swift becomes first woman to win BRITs Global Icon award
description: Taylor Swift is preparing to make history as the first woman to be awarded the Global Icon prize at the BRIT awards.

title: The blind tasting that changed wine forever
description: In a Parisian hotel 45 years ago, some of France's biggest wine experts came together for a blind tasting.

title: 'We eat and drink from garbage': Lebanon's disappearing Ramadan dinner
description: Beirut, Lebanon (CNN) — Khadija Khreiss has the equivalent of 35 cents in her wallet today. Tomorrow, she may have nothing.

title: Iron ore prices go ballistic as metals boom
description: As investors place bets on the economic recovery, there's a new frenzy that's taken over markets. Around the world, there's a rush to buy metals.

title: 'What are you doing here?' Lorna Falconer says she's faced racism and sexism in English football
description: You're hired! Football executive Lorna Falconer has never been on "The Apprentice," but the story of how she got a foot in the door of an industry that is notoriously difficult to enter for women, especially Black women, has echoes of the hit UK television show.

title: Hundreds of Palestinians injured in Israeli police clashes as tensions soar in Jerusalem
description: Hundreds of Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli police at one of Jerusalem's holiest sites on Monday, as tensions in the city continue to soar.

title: Strong winds leave tourist stranded on damaged glass bridge in China
description: Extreme weather is being blamed for a terrifying incident that left one tourist stranded on a 260-meter-high glass-bottomed suspension bridge in northeast China's Jilin province on May 7.

title: Chad military claims victory in battle with rebels that led to President Deby's death
description: Chad's military claimed victory on Sunday in its weeks-long battle with northern rebels that led to the death of President Idriss Deby on the battlefield.

title: Michael Jordan's game-worn North Carolina jersey sold for record $1.38 million
description: A game-worn jersey belonging to Michael Jordan from his sophomore season at the University of North Carolina was sold for a record $1.38 million on Saturday at Heritage Auctions.

title: Seth Rogen says he has no plans to work with James Franco again
description: Seth Rogen says has no current plans to work with his former collaborator James Franco, in the wake of sexual misconduct allegations.

title: Tiny Leonardo da Vinci bear sketch could fetch over $16M
description: A tiny sketch of a bear by Leonardo da Vinci is expected to sell for over $16 million at auction.

title: The deadly collapse of Mexico City's 'Golden Line' was a tragedy foretold
description: It's known as the "Golden Line." The Mexico City subway system Line 12, spanning 25.1 kilometers (15.6 miles) and featuring 20 stations, was touted as one of the most expensive and ambitious public works projects in Mexican history when it was inaugurated in October 2012.

title: The weapons seizure so big it covered the rear deck of a 567-foot US warship
description: A joint US Navy and Coast Guard team seized thousands of illicit weapons last week after stopping a small ship in the North Arabian Sea, the Navy said in a statement.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Juventus facing a season without Champions League football
description: For the first time in 19 years, Cristiano Ronaldo could miss out on playing in the Champions League.

title: Prime Minister Modi is under increasing pressure to take further action as the country grapples with the world's worst Covid-19 outbreak
description:
• LIVE UPDATES: Up to the IOC whether Tokyo Olympics will go forward, Japan's PM says
• When the US could see Covid cases and deaths plummet

title: China blames the US for hyping fears of uncontrolled rocket reentry
Spain celebrates as coronavirus curfew ends
description: Hundreds of Spanish citizens were seen partying as the country ended its coronavirus curfew in 13 of the country's 17 regions. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

title: Tough jobs report scrambles Washington battle ahead of crucial week
Trump issues bizarre statement about Kentucky Derby winner
description: CNN's Jim Acosta discusses former President Donald Trump's statement about Kentucky Derby winner Medina Spirit with Jim Avlon and Margaret Hoover. The racehorse tested positive for elevated levels of betamethasone, an anti-inflammatory corticosteroid that is allowed in horse racing at a certain level. A postrace test detected 21 picograms per milliliter -- more than double the legal threshold in Kentucky racing.

title: 'Don't know what the hell he's talking about': Acosta on Fox News host
description: CNN's Jim Acosta and CNN medical analyst Dr. Jonathan Reiner discuss the blowback that Fox News host Tucker Carlson has received over his anti-vaccine rhetoric.
